page.title: 05LOCAL ISSUES
page.content: Many things arouse the public's attention in this area, such as the gypsies on the North Farm Industrial Estate. These live in caravans and move from place to place. On 26th June 1985 a man was seriously injured in a fight which took place on the Estate. This involved more than 30 gypsies. Another problem is dogs fouling the parks in Tunbridge Wells; a group of volunteers has offered to clear up the parks on a regular basis. Vandals are also a problem in this area, causing great damage to property. 1985 was V.E.Day -40 years on- and many parties and events took place in celebration. Other reports that appear in the papers are of fund-raising efforts for charity. For example a man from High Brooms leapt from an aeroplane; he raised #170 for Mencap. There are many such events.
